wikipedia_page.main: William Holmes Sullivan (1836-1908) was a British painter who mainly painted history paintings, portraits, and war scenes. His works include various paintings based on William Shakespeare's Tragedy of Julius Caesar.

response: William Holmes Sullivan - The Fairy Ring; the Enchanted Piper.jpg|The Fairy Ring; the Enchanted Piper () by William Holmes Sullivan
File:Death of Julius Caesar 2.png|The Assassination of Julius Caesar by William Holmes Sullivan, c. 1888, Royal Shakespeare Theatre

link_mentions.page: List of painters by name beginning with "S"

response: The Assassination of Julius Caesar is a 1888 painting by William Holmes Sullivan which depicts the assassination of Julius Caesar at the hands of his fellow senators. The painting, like Sullivan's other works, is based on Shakespare's play the Tragedy of Julius Caesar and is placed in the Royal Shakespeare Theatre. A similar version by Sullivan is named Et tu Brute.
